criteria.title: Run aXe browser extension
criteria.description: If the page has dynamic content (the DOM is manipulated and content is added or removed programatically) then you need to put your page into a state in which it can be tested first.

criteria.title: Header tag order
criteria.description: Are headings in the correct order?

criteria.title: Landmark wrapping
criteria.description: Are all page elements contained in a landmark?

criteria.title: Landmark duplication
criteria.description: Is there only one <header>, <main> and <footer> on the page?

criteria.title: 1st level heading
criteria.description: Is there one <h1> on this page and does it accurately convey what's unique about this page?

criteria.title: Page Title
criteria.description: Does the page title accurately describe what's unique about this page?

criteria.title: Tabbing
criteria.description: Can you tab to everything you can click on?

criteria.title: Tabbing order
criteria.description: Does tabbing follow a logical order? Generally top-left to bottom-right?

criteria.title: Focus
criteria.description: Is the current keyboard focus obvious on every tabbable element, or do you sometimes not know where you are?

criteria.title: Forms
criteria.description: Fully complete a form - check the ability to use radio buttons and checkboxes

criteria.title: Non-visual controls
criteria.description: Ensure you're not able to tab into controls that are visually hidden (unless they are present as an accessibility feature e.g. "Skip to content" links

criteria.title: Persistent modals
criteria.description: Modal or modal-like interfaces should prevent tabbing back to the main content until the modal is closed

criteria.title: Esc!
criteria.description: Can you use the esc key to close modals or other dynamic interfaces?

criteria.title: Is the user informed of page updates?
criteria.description: If you interact with the page in a manner which modifies the DOM, is the screenreader notified of this?

criteria.title: Jump to headings
criteria.description: Use the H key to jump between headings on the page. Is the page's content easily accessible if navigating this way?

criteria.title: Skip links
criteria.description: Can you skip repetative or large amounts of supporting content?

criteria.title: Descriptive titles
criteria.description: Do the headings accurately describe the content they preceed?

criteria.title: Content graphics
criteria.description: Are there accurate text descriptions of images that contain content (not purely decorative imagery)?

criteria.title: Form submission error handling
criteria.description: Is it easy to recover, amend and resubmit a form with focus pulled to an error summary?

criteria.title: Form validation error handling
criteria.description: If a single form input fails validation, is it obvious to the user?

criteria.title: Mobile reflow
criteria.description: Page must reflow to 320 CSS pixels and scroll vertically

criteria.title: Screen zoom
criteria.description: Use a screen zoom application like windows magnifier

criteria.title: Colour contrast
criteria.description: Do you lose information or context if the page is set to greyscale?

criteria.title: Disable all CSS
criteria.description: Does the flow of the page still make sense?

criteria.title: Zoom to 200%
criteria.description: Is the page still fully usable if the browser is zoomed to 200%?
